# 2008 Massachusetts Republican presidential primary

| image1 = File:AnnMarie Romneym (cropped).jpg
| image_size = 150x150px
| nominee1 = Mitt Romney
| color1 = 85bb65
| home_state1 = Massachusetts
| delegate_count1 = 22
| popular_vote1 = 255,892
| percentage1 = 51.92%
| image2 = File:John McCain official portrait 2009 (cropped).jpg
| nominee2 = John McCain
| color2 = ce5c17
| home_state2 = Arizona
| delegate_count2 = 18
| popular_vote2 = 204,779
| percentage2 = 41.68%
| map_image = Massachusetts_Republican_Presidential_Primary_Election_Results_by_County,_2008.svg
| map_size =
| map_caption = Election results by county.
| outgoing_members = IL
| elected_members = MN
| votes_for_election = 43 delegates to the Republican National Convention(40 pledged, 3 unpledged)
}}
The 2008 Massachusetts Republican presidential primary took place on February 5, 2008, with 40 national delegates. Polls indicated that former Governor of Massachusetts Mitt Romney was leading rival John McCain; Romney ended up defeating McCain by roughly 10% of the vote.
